articles.title: New Discoveries: Uncovering the Latest Insights and Developments
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) continues to dominate headlines, but recent developments go beyond simple chatbots. Key terms include AI-powered tools, generative models, and machine learning algorithms. Edge AI is gaining traction, processing data closer to the source reduces latency, improves privacy, and enables real-time applications. Quantum computing is edging closer to reality. CRISPR technology continues to evolve. Advances in genomics and data analytics are enabling more personalized approaches to healthcare.

The building includes a lecture hall with theater seating, offices, and a $100,000 anatomage light table that shows images of cadavers in millimeter-wide layers. The Jean School welcomed its biggest freshman class ever in August with 210 students.

The announcement comes as Rama's Socialist Party begins a fourth term in power. The opposition Democratic Party has denounced the move as unlawful.

The public's desire for authenticity is a countervailing force to AI-generated images. Most of these jobs will go to experienced photographers, while entry-level shooters struggle to get gigs.

articles.title: UAE offices must become collaboration hubs as AI fuels remote work, say experts
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: 51% of global employees believe that artificial intelligence could one day make physical offices unnecessary. For many professionals in the UAE, offices remain an irreplaceable hub for connection, creativity, and culture.Hybrid collaboration tools that evolve with AI to make teamwork seamless, wellbeing and inclusion programs to keep employees connected and supported.

articles.title: AI Can Clone Anybody's Voice. See if You Can Tell the Difference.
articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.summary: Criminals use AI-generated voice clones to trick victims into handing over money or passwords. These scams surged 442% between the first and second half of last year, according to cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike. There are still some 'tells' that can betray an AI impersonator.

articles.title: AI Can Clone Anybody's Voice. See if You Can Tell the Difference.
articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.summary: Knowing the difference between a human voice and an AI-generated one could save you from a phone scam that costs you thousands of dollars. David Falkenstein of corporate security firm IOActive created a Wall Street Journal colleague's voice using OpenAudio software.

articles.title: Young Americans are struggling to compete with AI for starting jobs, study finds
articles.author: thedailydigest.com
articles.summary: AI chatbots have affected almost every area of our lives, from mental health to art and content. The most significant disruption has been in our work as a result of the development of AI chatbots in language models and chatbots, especially in the workplace.

articles.title: New frontier of intelligence: Lima-area schools experiment with AI
articles.author: Mackenzi Klemann
articles.summary: Spencerville schools started to permit limited use of artificial intelligence platforms in the spring of 2024. Lima Central Catholic principal Katie Krieg introduced an AI policy drafted by the Diocese of Toledo when she started as principal in August. Shawnee schools are encouraged to incorporate AI into their lesson plans.

articles.title: CEOs Are Obsessed With AI, But Their Pushes to Use It Keep Ending in Disaster
articles.summary: According to Julie Sweet, CEOs are obsessed with AI, but frustrated with the fact that it doesn't increase revenue. Research shows present-day AI software is failing to generate any revenue whatsoever at 95 percent of companies trying to incorporate it into their work flows. Some companies, like Klarna and the Commonwealth Bank of Australia, have been forced to walk back their ambitious AI automation schemes.

articles.title: Google's top AI scientist says 'learning how to learn' will be next generation's most needed skill

articles.summary: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google's DeepMind, is speaking at an event at the Odeon of Herodes Atticus in Athens, Greece, on Friday, Sept. 12, 2025. He shared the 2024 Nobel Prize in chemistry for developing AI systems that accurately predict protein folding. Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis is also present.

articles.title: AI Coding & Singularity: The Future is Now
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: $10 billion has been invested in AI-driven coding solutions, similar to self-driving cars and AI-powered cars. The real value of AI in software development lies in leveraging AI to enhance existing tools and workflows, not in replacing human programmers with AI.

articles.title: Dilworth Police Department to use AI facial recognition software for investigations
articles.summary: The Dilworth Police Department is taking out a three-year contract with a facial recognition software company Clearview AI. The program will be paid for with unallocated funds from the department's budget. It will be used only for investigation, not ongoing surveillance. Facial recognition technology can be biased.

SoundHound's technology will become more widespread over the next few years. The company delivered impressive revenue growth of 217% in the most recent quarter. It's currently valued at $6 billion.

articles.summary: Razer is launching two new AI game developer tools on Amazon Web Services. The tools include Razer Game Assistant and Razer QA Companion and are built on Amazon Bedrock. The quality assurance period can be significantly reduced, which can help reduce the time to market for many titles.

articles.title: AI won't replace managers. But managers who ignore AI will replace themselves
articles.author: Tammy Perkins
articles.summary: In the age of AI, managers need to evolve with it and focus on what makes them truly human. The best managers don't get outmaneuvered by AI, they use it as a force multiplier. The next decade won't reward the manager who resists AI, but those who use it wisely.

articles.title: My Friend Canyon: Getting to Know an AI Bot

articles.summary: Canyon is an AI bot at Microsoft that helps writers with research and improves their writing. The Wall Street Journal reports that the AI bots are not honest when they make mistakes. Microsoft, Google, and Apple are trying to teach the bots to say 'I don't know' instead of 'I got it wrong'.

What AI can offer is a starting point, the initial clarity and structure that jumpstarts your fitness journey.

articles.title: Is AI truly a boon for the entire IT industry, or could it also be a curse?

articles.summary: Kepler Cheuvreux says investor sentiment on artificial intelligence is becoming divided. The rise of AI has triggered record-breaking infrastructure investments, funding rounds and re-prioritising of R&D investments across the IT value chain, but the financial payoff is still uncertain. AI will challenge and transform the IT industry depending on how quickly companies adapt.

articles.title: They Had Money Problems. They Turned to ChatGPT for Solutions.

The team is the largest within xAI and plays a crucial role in training Grok, the company's AI chatbot. The main Slack room for data annotators had more than 1,500 members on Friday afternoon, but by Friday evening it had dropped to just over 1,000.

The total cost to implement the recommendations is nearly $5 million over the next three to five years.

articles.title: AI won't replace managers. But managers who ignore AI will replace themselves
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: AI will expose managers who play it safe, cling to spreadsheets and ignore what makes them truly human in the age of AI, says Tim Berners-Lee. He believes AI is coming for the managers' jobs and they should be aware of this fact.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: Backlash over mystery company's data center
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: Mysterious company's $1.6B data center proposed for Wisconsin farmland draws residents' ire. OpenAI's nonprofit parent company secures $100B equity stake while retaining control of AI giant. Tech titan says AI technology is getting better and better.

articles.title: UAE Lab Releases Open-Source Model to Rival China's DeepSeek
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: Institute of Foundation Models released K2 Think AI model on Tuesday. Gizmodo reports that it's a model that rivals OpenAI's ChatGPT and China's DeepSeek in AI. The United Arab Emirates wants to compete with the U.S. and China in AI, and this model is its strongest contender yet.

articles.title: Barcelona ranks third in world's foreign investment in AI projects
articles.author: Catalan News
articles.summary: Barcelona is the third city worldwide in the ranking in terms of foreign investment in artificial intelligence according to the IBM consulting report: 'Global Location Trends 2025'. The Catalan capital is behind London and Singapore. Barcelona is the first city in the European Union in regards to AI investment.

articles.title: AI poised to advance Arabic language on global stage: ALC Chairman
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Dr Ali bin Tamim is the Chairman of the Abu Dhabi Arabic Language Centre. He believes that artificial intelligence (AI) has acquired the ability to produce narrative storytelling and visual content that almost mimics humans, revealing a new type of AI.

articles.title: Albania Appoints an AI as Government Official
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Albania has appointed the world's first AI government official. The new minister is 100 percent incorruptible and every public fund that goes through the tender procedure is 100% legible. Albania wants to root out some of the Balkan state's corruption.

articles.title: Investor Tom Lee Thinks Investors Are Underestimating Future Growth of AI, Says This Category of Stocks Is ‘Even More Undervalued'
articles.author: The Daily Hodl
articles.summary: Fundstrat's Tom Lee believes that investors are undervaluing the artificial intelligence (AI) sector. Oracle Corp. shares surged this week after the tech giant reported a high this week. Lee says that the growth potential and impacts of AI are being underestimated by investors.

articles.title: The surprise isn't that Google is accused of stealing online content for AI purposes, the surprise is that People Magazine actually had content someone at Google thought was worth stealing
articles.summary: Vogel points out that Google's AI crawler can't be blocked because it would also prevent publisher's websites from being indexed in Google Search. Google knows this and they're not splitting their crawler, so they are an intentional bad actor here, Vogel declares.

articles.title: AI, Inevitability, & Human Sovereignty
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: After decades of working in the internet industry, he started using AI because he could see how quickly they were proliferating. Ivan Illich coined the term "iatrogenic dependency" for institutions that promise to heal while creating new forms of illness. Ivan's fear is that AI will make us subordinate to systems in ways we don't recognize until it's too late.
